ingredients.item: 1 pack essential Waitrose 3 mixed peppers, deseeded, thinly sliced
400g pack essential Waitrose British chicken breast chunks
500g low-fat natural yogurt (don’t use 0% fat yogurt, which will curdle)
300g broccoli or peas, steamed, to serve

instructions.step: Preheat the oven to 180ºC, gas mark 4. Heat a little spray oil in a large sauté pan, add the peppers and onions, and fry for 3-4 minutes. Remove from the pan and set aside.
Add the chicken and stir-fry for 3-4 minutes or until golden. Add the tikka paste and fry for 1 minute. Stir in the stock, then return the peppers and onions to the pan.

In a small bowl, mix the cornflour with a little water to make a smooth paste and then stir into the yogurt. Add this mixture to the pan, along with the coriander. Stir well and warm through for 1-2 minutes.
Spoon the tikka mixture into a 1-litre serving dish. Cut each filo sheet into 4 long strips, spray with a little spray oil and scrunch up. Place on top of the chicken tikka filling.
Bake in the oven for 20-25 minutes or until the pastry is golden brown and the filling is bubbling hot. Serve with steamed broccoli or peas.
